Posted By: Mowagh (1/23/2013 6:40:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
evolve is a triggered ability. it seems that it triggers when a creature comes into play. does it check the power and toughness of the new creature on resolution or immediately?  
  
for instance:  
i want to play a weaker creature  
but i want to get a +1/+1 counter from evolve  
so i play the creature  
evolve goes on the stack  
i respond with a pump card to the new weaker creature  
it makes it stronger than the creature with evolve  
evolve resolves with a +1/+1 counter  
  
correct or wrong?
posts.html:
evolve is a triggered ability. it seems that it triggers when a creature comes into play. does it check the power and toughness of the new creature on resolution or immediately?

for instance:
i want to play a weaker creature
but i want to get a +1/+1 counter from evolve
so i play the creature
evolve goes on the stack
i respond with a pump card to the new weaker creature
it makes it stronger than the creature with evolve
evolve resolves with a +1/+1 counter

correct or wrong?

posts.post_content:
T1: Island, Cloudfin Raptor  
T2: Forest, [Young Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Young Wolf)  
Evolve triggers resolves, and Cloudfin Raptor is 1/2.  
[Rapid Hybridization](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rapid Hybridization) targeting Young Wolf.   
Undying trigger resolves, then evolve off the 2/2 wolf, and Cloudfin is 2/3. Evolve then resolves for 3/3 token. Attack on turn two with your 3/4 flier.
posts.html:
T1: Island, Cloudfin Raptor
T2: Forest, Young Wolf
Evolve triggers resolves, and Cloudfin Raptor is 1/2.
Rapid Hybridization targeting Young Wolf.
Undying trigger resolves, then evolve off the 2/2 wolf, and Cloudfin is 2/3. Evolve then resolves for 3/3 token. Attack on turn two with your 3/4 flier.

Turn two: [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain), [Burning-Tree Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning-Tree Emissary), [Lightning Mauler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Mauler) bonded to Emissary and swing for six on turn 2.

posts.post_content:
Cards like this are obviously amazing on the curve in your opening hand and not good to actually draw. Cards like fathom mage and zegana can draw enough cards to mollify the late-game draw of this though. Simic hardly ever has to top-deck as a result, so the nightmare of topping this late-game I'm not really concerned about.   
  
1cc evolve is crazy.
